Some managers even practice reviewing the project contracts with their team to ensure the team understands exactly what they are collectively responsible for.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Expectations for individuals usually center around that individual’s roles and responsibilities but may also include clarity around how self-sufficient the individual should be, when he/she should flag or escalate a risk, and what level of communication should exist in addition to reporting. Even senior leaders need clarity around the expectations of them individually. If anything, it is MORE important to clarify expectations with senior leaders because they are usually self-sufficient and independent. Without clear distinctions between areas of responsibilities, senior leaders may run into unnecessary conflicts or double work.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A combination of individual conversations and a communal review of a RACI is a good practice to start clarifying these expectations.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Communication: Build Your Communication Plan\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Especially for large, complex and complicated engagements; if you do not plan your communication effectively, you will not have effective communication. Therefore put aside time to build out a communication plan. A communication plan documents the communication needs of all stakeholders and identifies a process to meet those needs. It establishes the who, what when and how. This does not mean overscheduling meetings nor does it mean that leaders must be present on every calls. It does mean establishing relationships between leaders and teams where avenues of communication can exist across and down the portfolio outside of formal status reports. Allow opportunities for informal insights, questions and concerns to inform decision makers so that they can determine where to prioritize their attention within a large engagement.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Be sure to also check out our tips on \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://kb.epam.com/display/GDOKB/Handling+Clients#HandlingClients-BuildingaClientRelationship\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Building a Client Relationship\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\".\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-4\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Case Study: Canadian Tire\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Here is a great Case Study from Canadian Tire that may help give insight into managing complicated and complex projects as they scale: \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://kb.epam.com/display/EPMDMO/Canadian+Tire%3A+Fighting+The+Mystery\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Canadian Tire: Fighting The Mystery - DM Central (DMC) - EPAM Knowledge Base\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Main Conclusions Made Throughout the Project:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Scale matters.
